text: WHEN A movie OF A book seems pointless AND incomprehensible the cause can invariably be FOUND IN the book either it was pointless TO START WITH OR the point IS one NOT easily conveyed TO film OR the movie missed the point which IS the most frequent OF these results AND the easiest TO happen especially WHEN the point IS one NOT easily DEFINED DOT the book morvern callar has A point EVERY reader OF the book must have felt this AND felt AS IF he had gotten it but i suspect most OF them could NOT STATE it IN words DOT i M NOT sure i can myself but perhaps it comes TO this OR something LIKE it things come things GO such IS life but we carry ON OR AT ANY rate SOME OF us people LIKE morvern DO DOT NO doubt A MORE erudite critic could construct A MORE adequate definition DOT but the important fact IS that there IS A point possibly the SUM OF the entire story IS the point AND that this would have been the main thing TO keep IN VIEW AND TO carry OVER IN adapting the story TO film DOT the maker OF this film evidently missed the point AND doesn T substitute one OF her own AND so the film IS about NOTHING DOT br br this IS NOT the usual complaint OF A book lover that his favorite TEXT has been violated DOT the merit OF the book IS something i conceded grudgingly IN reading it i FOUND it A bloody nuisance AND an occasion FOR kicking the author IN the pants AND getting him IN TO finish the job properly DOT the narrative IS supposed TO be the WORK OF the half educated morvern but that illusion IS constantly dispelled BY A dozen different TYPES OF literary effect AS IF the author were poking AT her WITH his pen there ARE inconsistencies OF STYLE AND tone AS IF different sections had been composed AT different times AND ANY conclusions i could reach about morvern had TO remain tentative because it was uncertain which implications the author intended AND which he did NOT FOR INSTANCE despite morvern s own SELF characterization AS A raver am i wrong that IN the END she remains essentially A working CLASS scots girl AND beneath her wrapping OF music downloads NOT so different FROM those OF generations past IN ANY CASE despite my irritation AT the author i couldn T deny that his book stuck WITH me AND what i couldn T GET OUT OF my head was his CHARACTER s attitude her angle ON the world which was almost AS vivid AS A goya portrait DOT morvern IS the kind OF person who s ALWAYS encountering situations AT once rather comic AND rather horrible occasionally she invites them but MORE often they land ON her LIKE flies so that much OF her life consists OF A kind OF gauche but graceful slogging through unconsciously practical AND unconsciously philosophical AND that doesn T BEGIN TO DESCRIBE it idiosyncratically enough DOT the complex OF incidents AND OF morvern s responses TO them ARE the substance OF the book AND its achievement IN exposing A CROSS SECTION OF existence it would be difficult TO illuminate otherwise FOR ALL my dislike OF the book i can see this DOT br br the morvern just described IS NOT the morvern OF the movie OR IF it IS most OF her IS kept offscreen DOT an actress who might have been A good fit FOR the CHARACTER had she been the RIGHT age AT the RIGHT TIME IS angharad rees FROM the OLD tv series poldark DOT samantha morton THEN would seem LIKE good casting she s rather the same sort OF actress AND IN one OF her earlier movies jesus son she played A girl who WITH A few adjustments could have been turned INTO this one DOT unfortunately AS the film turned OUT she doesn T have the CHARACTER FROM the book TO play DOT FOR one thing the book IS one that IF it IS TO be dramatized virtually cries OUT FOR monologues BY the main CHARACTER TO the audience WITHOUT her COMMENTS her perspective her voice the story loses most OF its meaning DOT it has lost MORE OF it IN that the adaptor has expurgated it OF its comic AND horrible elements the most memorable incidents FROM the book ARE curtailed BEFORE they turn grotty AND so morvern s responses whether OF amusement OR distaste depending ON her mood ARE missing too AND the incidents NO longer have A reason FOR being IN the story DOT IN short the filmmaker chose FOR SOME reason TO turn A brisk edgy serio comic novel INTO A genteel art tv film AND chose AS her typical image one OF ms DOT morton languishing IN A artistically shaded melancholy AS IF the outing morvern signs up FOR were A tour OF the stations OF the CROSS DOT this isn T AT ALL what the book OR the morvern OF the book was about DOT FOR another thing the morvern OF the movie isn T scottish the actress said IN an interview she hadn T had TIME TO study up the accent AND she ought TO be it s important that she her FAMILY AND her mates ARE ALL FROM A single place DOT AND finally the film IS missing the END OF the story morvern s spending ALL she has AND coming home TO icy darkness it s winter the dam has frozen the POWER has gone OUT AND the pub IS dark DOT minus this AND minus ALL OF the rest what s LEFT IS A failed art film A dead film about A subject whose strength lay precisely IN her refusal OR native inability ever TO give IN TO being dead DOT
label: safe.txt

text: AFTER watching A dozen episodes i decided TO give up ON this SHOW since it depicts IN an unrealistic manner what IS mathematical modeling DOT IN the episodes that charlie would predict the future behavior OF individuals USING mathematical models i thought that my profession was being joked about DOT i am NOT A mathematician INSTEAD A chemical engineer but i DO WORK A lot WITH mathematical models DOT so i will try TO EXPLAIN TO the layman why what IS shown IS CLOSE TO make believe OF fairy tales DOT br br FIRST choosing the RIGHT model TO predict A situation IS A demanding task DOT charlie eppes IS shown AS A genius but even him would have TO spend considerable TIME researching FOR A suitable model specifically FOR trying TO guess what someone will DO OR WHERE he will be IN the near future DOT individuals ARE erratic AND haphazard there IS NO modeling FOR them DOT isaac asimov even wrote about that IN the s DOT even IF there were A model FOR SPECIFIC kind OF individual it would be A probabilistic stoichastic one meaning it has good chance OF making A wrong prediction DOT br br SECOND supposing the RIGHT model FOR someone OR A situation IS FOUND the model parameters have TO be known DOT these parameters ARE the constants OF the equations such AS the gravity acceleration DOT M s AND often ARE NOT easy TO determine DOT again charlie eppes would have TO be someone beyond genius TO know the RIGHT parameters FOR the model he chooses DOT AND AFTER the model AND the parameters ARE chosen they would have TO be tested DOT oddly they ARE NOT AND BY miracle they fit exactly the situation that IS being predicted DOT br br third A very important aspect OF modeling IS almost ALWAYS neglected NOT ONLY BY numbers but ALSO BY sci fi movies the computational effort required FOR solving these models DOT try TO make excel solve A complex model WITH many equations AND variables AND one will find doing A herculean job DOT even IF charlie eppes has the RIGHT software TO solve his models he might be stuck WITH hardware that will be dreadfully slow DOT AND even WITH the RIGHT software hardware combination the model solution might well take days TO be reached DOT he solves them IMMEDIATELY i could USE his computer IN my research WORK i would be very glad DOT br br AS A drama it IS far FROM being the best SHOW DOT the CHARACTERS ARE somewhat stereotyped but NOT even remotely funny AS those IN big bang theory ARE DOT the crimes ARE dull AND the way charlie eppes solves them sometimes make the fbi look pretty incompetent DOT br br FOR SOME layman the SHOW might WORK DOT FOR OTHERS the way things ARE handled makes it difficult TO swallow
label: safe.txt

be breaking up BY the blows OF bad luck LIKE an asteroid entering the atmosphere A little metaphor that comes up WHEN bruce miraculously finds himself A gigantic news story later IN the film DOT bruce IS nearly years OLD AND ALL he has TO SHOW FOR it IS A POSITION AS A news reporter OF the sort that reports ON such exciting news AS the LOCAL bakery that s seeking TO bake the world s biggest cookie DOT he s desperate TO obtain the job OF head anchor AT the tv station but he loses his cool ON live tv WHEN he hears that the job went TO his rival colleague DOT you have TO love how they TIME the revelation OF this news TO him seconds BEFORE his FIRST live report DOT needless TO say he loses his temper ON live tv IN one OF the funniest scenes OF the entire film DOT br br morgan freeman delivers A fantastic performance AS the man himself displaying A god whose infinite wisdom IS somewhat reflected through freeman s massive talent AS an actor DOT he IS the kind OF god who takes his job very seriously but IN such A way AS TO advise his followers AS well AS the viewers OF this movie that there ARE times WHEN you need TO slow down AND DO SOME manual labor IN life DOT i love his line that SOME OF the happiest people IN the world come home smelling TO high heaven AT the END OF the DAY DOT there ARE A lot OF people IN the world maybe MORE than our SHARE IN america who ARE so absorbed BY their money AND their possessions AND their jobs AND everything that they completely lost touch WITH the NATURAL side OF themselves AS humans DOT br br one OF the biggest strengths IS that the movie IS able TO provide great advice TO people IN GENERAL about improving their lives AND this message IS clear AND acceptable regardless OF the viewer s religion DOT i FOR example tend TO reject organized religion IN ALL forms AND i see god AND satan TO be metaphors FOR different aspects OF nature AND human psychology rather than actual figures who ever lived OR CONTINUE TO live DOT but despite the fact that i don T believe that god EXISTS AS an entity overseeing the universe OR AS A janitor dressed ALL IN white who mops the floors OF his downtown office IN his spare TIME i was able TO appreciate the messages that were delivered IN this movie DOT br br jim carrey s movies display this fantastic evolution that TIES them ALL together AND makes the newer ones look even better just AND the majestic easily one OF his GREATEST films ever DOT jim carrey has unmistakably moved FROM the cheesy comedy OF his past TO become one OF the most important comic actors working today DOT br br jennifer aniston ALSO once again provides an excellent addition TO the movie AS she did IN the side splitting office SPACE AS bruce s girlfriend who becomes increasingly exasperated BY bruce s growing stress about his life AS well AS his negligence TO ask her TO marry him DOT there IS definitely SOME low brow comedy IN the film that doesn T really fit WITH the importance OF the film s meaning OR the quality OF the delivery such AS the dog reading the newspaper ON the toilet AND the whole monkey scene but it was definitely pretty nice TO see ace ventura s friend spike make A cameo appearance DOT AS stephen king very well knows it s ALWAYS nice TO see familiar CHARACTERS DOT it s almost LIKE seeing FAMILY again DOT br br bruce IS endowed WITH the powers OF god FOR A given PERIOD OF TIME so that he can understand life A BIT better AND he says A lot about himself WHEN he uses the powers ONLY FOR his own purposes rather than TO help ALL OF the people who pray TO him DOT the thing i love about this IS that LIKE i said BEFORE religion IS ABSENT FROM my life but i was able TO watch this AND learn A lot about myself AS well BY thinking about what kinds OF things i would have done had i dental records the scene WHERE bruce s rival colleague IS made TO GO nuts ON camera AND my favorites the ones AT the beginning AND the END involving the LOCAL bakery s cooking DOT the movie has plenty OF TIME FOR carrey TO deliver SOME excellent jokes such AS WHEN he says TO god who reveals that he s the janitor the proprietor the electrician etc that his christmas parties must be REAL bashes AND TO be careful about drinking because ON OF him might need A ride home i ALSO loved the END WHEN he says that behind EVERY great man IS A woman rolling her eyes DOT A little too TRUE AND AS gallagher would ADD behind EVERY great man IS ALSO an amazed mother IN law DOT br br bruce almighty IS one OF the MORE memorable comedies TO have come OUT FOR quite A WHILE AND IS probably the ONLY directly religious that i can remember seeing that i am anxious TO buy ON dvd TO ADD TO my personal collection DOT it IS A comedy written AND performed IN good taste but WITH enough relatively low brow humor TO keep the kids entertained DOT this IS A meaningful comedy FOR the whole FAMILY which IS becoming rarer AND rarer these days DOT IN A world that IS about TO be flogged WITH yet another american pie text: it has said that the movies AND baseball BOTH thrived during the great depression DOT it appears that the grim realities OF A nation caught up IN the aftermath OF this economic disaster created A need FOR occasional relief FOR the populace DOT A TEMPORARY ESCAPE could be FOUND IN the ON going soap opera that IS baseball DOT br br likewise an occasional excursion OF OR hours INTO the darkened auditoriums OF the cinema DOT the presence OF A radio IN just about everyone s house HOLD kept depression era america AT once attuned TO world s events AND provided many A drama AND especially comedy shows FOR A pleasant interlude FROM harsh reality DOT br br the literature OF the TIME ALSO flourished AT ALL levels DOT the juvenile reading habits helped TO CREATE the comic book AS we know it what WITH ALL the fantastic CHARACTERS AND super exciting adventures DOT but the comic book just did NOT magically appear ALL fully developed WITH ALL the colorful color pages ALL BY itself DOT there were mediums that were ancestral TO them DOT obviously the newspaper comic STRIP was one parent providing the visual narrative METHOD OF story telling DOT br br the other direct ancestor was the pulp magazine DOT the inexpensive prose story publications that carried A great deal OF stories OF the same adventure CHARACTERS IN ON going though NOT necessarily serialized tales DOT the pulp medium had been around FOR SOME decades AND introduced us TO edgar rice borrough s tarzan AND johnston mcculley s zorro DOT the s brought forth A bumper crop AS feature CHARACTERS LIKE the shadow the avenger G s battle aces AND the spider master OF men ALL FOUND their way TO the news stands among many OTHERS DOT br br one other was doc savage A FULL blooded super hero OF the written story the covers OF the pulps had perhaps the ONLY picture OF the hero DOT possessing extraordinary strength super keen senses AND A protean genius CLASS intellect doc was the prototype super hero DOT br br he ALSO assembled OF his former army buddies INTO A small FREE lancing team OF adventurers DOT EACH OF them was an expert IN A given field DOT so we had A top rated chemist lawyer construction engineer electrical engineer geologist archaeologist paleontologist etc DOT br br the doc savage stories were very popular IN the s AND s AND were published INTO the middle s DOT THEN they went INTO A hiatus FOR A good years DOT THEN the brainstorm came about TO repackage the OLD novels IN NEW container the paperback book DOT A fresh look TO the cover art was introduced featuring A highly stylized series OF paintings OF A very muscular doc WITH A perpetually ripped shirt DOT br br the re introduction proved TO be highly successful WITH the publication OF A title A MONTH AND FOR A WHILE MORE DOT soon there was A rumor OF A doc savage movie but WHEN BY what producer well the venerable man OF bronze was back ON the news stands FOR OVER years BEFORE ANY REAL project got put together DOT it was veteran stop ACTION animator AND producer OF top special effects films geoprge pal who did the film along WITH warner brothers DOT br br WHEN doc savage man OF bronze arrived IN the movie houses it boasted OF A well casted team OF actors albeit A largely NO NAME AS far familiarity WITH the viewers DOT WITH former tarzan OF tv ron ely s nearly perfect casting IN the LEAD up AND coming beauty OF A starlette pamela hensley IN the female LEAD AND veteran CHARACTER paul wexler AS the villainous captain seas NO other NAME would have been recognized DOT AND just maybe that was A plus IN this CASE DOT br br the story does A fine job OF BOTH getting most OF the audience acquainted WITH the incredible GROUP AND AT the same TIME GET A plot going DOT USE OF narration BY paul frees AND short film clips ARE the METHOD pursued TO MOVE the introduction along TO the main body OF the story DOT br br FROM the very START there ARE hints that this story will GO WITH the same sort OF manufactured camp humor AS the batman tv series DOT SOME really great looking early scenes involving doc AND the whole crew doing their individual specialties ARE thrown toward humor BY the paul frees narration AND the unexpected unlikely outcomes DOT FOR example an experiment OF doc s WITH A miniature rocket missile turns OUT TO be part OF A METHOD OF catching fish A small one AT that DOT the whole story unfolds LIKE that hitting the viewer WITH A little camp EVERY so often AS TO keep reminding us NOT TO take it too seriously DOT we ARE ALSO puzzled about mr DOT george pal s being the producer his LAST DOT he who had been so well known FOR special effects surely A factor that could be put TO good USE IN A sci fi ACTION setting OF the pulp CHARACTER s world DOT br br i can remember seeing it quite vividly DOT mrs DOT ryan deanna was IN the hospital just HAVING given birth TO our nd child michelle DOT our older girl jennifer was visiting her grandmother so AFTER visiting hours were OVER IN the maternity ward it was straight OVER TO the OLD marquette theatre rd kedzie here IN chicago DOT br br HAVING seen it AND being A guy WITH A good familiarity WITH doc i was sort OF let down BY the FINAL product DOT i could accept A little OF this camp business but would NOT have objected IF mr DOT pal would have seen fit TO let it ALL hang OUT AND have SOME REAL neat dinosaurs AND volcanoes TO give it ALL A little MORE pulp comic serial TYPE excitement DOT br br AND yet the CAST headed up BY mr DOT ely AND the OTHERS made the whole film likable IF NOT lovable DOT the SETS AND locations were AS far AS we can see very much LIKE those OF A s serial OR adventure flick which would be enjoyable TO about anyone DOT br br AND maybe that s just what they were trying FOR WITH this doc savage man OF bronze DOT

text: given the title this FIRST follow up TO quartet obviously reduces the NUMBER OF w DOT somerset maugham stories which comprise the film DOT the author still turns up TO introduce the episodes but there s NO epilogue this TIME around BY the way WHILE the script OF the original compendium gave sole credit TO r DOT C DOT sheriff here maugham himself ALSO lent A hand IN the adaptation AS well AS noel langley though it s unclear whether they contributed one segment EACH OR ELSE worked IN unison DOT AS can be expected much OF the crew OF quartet has been retained FOR the SECOND installment though this ALSO extends TO AT LEAST three CAST members namely naunton wayne wilfrid hyde white AND felix aylmer the LAST two had BIT parts IN the episode FROM quartet entitled the colonel s lady DOT WHILE trio ultimately emerges TO be A lesser achievement than its predecessor slightly unbalanced BY the third story which takes up MORE than half the running TIME it s still done WITH the utmost care acted WITH verve BY A stellar CAST AND IS solidly enjoyable INTO the bargain DOT br br the verger tells OF A church sexton james hayter FOR which the story s title IS another word who s dismissed AFTER years OF service BY the NEW parish priest michael hordern simply because he s illiterate DOT rather than rest ON his laurels despite his age he NOT ONLY takes A wife his landlady played BY kathleen harrison but opens A tobacconist shop strategically placed IN A lengthy stretch OF road WHERE NO such service IS offered AND WITH business flourishing this IS developed INTO A whole CHAIN DOT the LAST scene THEN sees him pay A visit TO bank manager felix aylmer who NOT ONLY IS surprised TO learn OF hayter s lack OF education but IS prompted TO ask him what his other interests were TO which the wealthy AND respected tobacconist replies WITH SOME measure OF irony that he had the calling TO be A verger br br the SECOND episode mr DOT know ALL IS the shortest but ALSO perhaps the most engaging A voyage AT sea IS utterly beleaguered BY the insufferable presence OF A pompous young man nigel patrick british despite his FOREIGN sounding NAME OF kelada who professes TO be an authority ON virtually EVERY subject UNDER the sun DOT naunton wayne AND wilfrid hyde white ARE the two passengers who have TO put up WITH him the most the latter because he shares A cabin WITH the man AND the former IN VIEW OF patrick s attentions TO his pretty wife anne crawford DOT during A fancy dress party however the passengers decide TO enact their revenge ON kelada BY HAVING one OF them impersonate him A jest which he naturally doesn T appreciate still it s here that he contrives TO SHOW A decent side TO his CHARACTER told BY crawford that the necklace she s wearing IS an imitation wayne challenges patrick TO NAME its pricebut the latter realizes IMMEDIATELY that it s the genuine article AND that this would compromise crawford s POSITION IF he were TO tell so kelada allows himself TO be publicly ridiculed rather than expose the fact that the woman probably has A secret admirer br br AS can ALSO be deduced FROM the title sanatorium deals WITH the myriad patients AT such A place run BY andre morell the protagonist IS A NEW intern roland culver who wistfully observes the various goings ON DOT the narrative IN fact highlights IN particular three separate strands OF plot one humorous the feud BETWEEN two aged scots LONG resident AT the sanatorium played BY finlay currie AND john laurie one melodramatic the erratic relationship BETWEEN disgruntled patient raymond huntley AND LONG suffering but devoted wife betty ann davies AND one bittersweet the romance BETWEEN nave but charming jean simmons AND dashing cad michael rennie which IN spite OF HAVING pretty much everything against it INCLUDING the fact that morell has diagnosed simmons AS A lifer WHILE rennie ONLY has A few years LEFT TO him leads the couple TO the altar DOT
label: safe.txt

text: this SHOW IS A perfect example OF how the cbc should stick TO either news sports OR satirical sketch comedy DOT AS A developer OF situation comedy cbc has shown it can combine the pizazz OF king OF kensington WITH the belly laughs OF the beachcombers DOT it IS an embarrassment TO great shows LIKE kids IN the hall AND SECOND city that they have TO SHARE their comedic roots WITH this lame production DOT br br i have TO admit that i didn T give this SHOW much OF A chance RIGHT FROM WHEN i FIRST heard OF its concept DOT TO START half OF the concept IS A direct attempt TO rip OFF one OF the few sitcom successes IN english canadian history corner gas DOT the rest OF the concept the cultural clash IS far FROM being original AND IS too often used AS A crutch FOR screen writing laziness DOT the selection OF the muslim religion AS the basis FOR the fish OUT OF water CHARACTERS seems TO be A desperate attempt TO be edgy AND topical but comes OFF AS forced DOT SOME OF the jokes that ARE based around the LOCAL s reaction TO the newcomers ARE cringe inducing AND thoroughly insulting TO the intelligence OF everyone involved especially the audience DOT br br this SHOW IS A perfect example OF how cbc just doesn T GET it WHEN it comes TO creating canadian CONTENT especially WHEN presenting canada AS A multicultural environment DOT cultural diversity IN canada does NOT have TO be presented IN such A heavy handed AND forced way DOT it would be A refreshing change TO see cbc introduce diversity INTO A television SHOW WITHOUT making the SHOW ALL about said diversity DOT i doubt that cbc has sufficient sitcom talent TO pull OFF something so subtle DOT A comparison could be made TO the way diversity IS depicted IN corner gas i DOT e DOT the aboriginal CHARACTERS ARE NOT SET apart BY their ethnicity nor IS their heritage used TO generate story lines DOT MORE realistically their lives AND the other CHARACTERS lives intertwine IN A way that makes ethnicity NO MORE significant than ANY OF their other personal CHARACTERISTICS DOT br br that being said even AS A formulaic fish OUT OF water comedy this SHOW fails DOT the acting IS weak the comic pacing ALL OVER the MAP AND the story premises that i saw were too far beyond the suspension OF belief even FOR A comedy DOT the ONLY saving grace IS the talented derek mcgrath who IS horribly wasted here DOT i doubt that even the addition OF guest stars colin mochrie FOR example AS an anglican archbishop can save this dog DOT i decided TO give the SHOW A chance once the cbc s hype had died down but two episodes were ALL i could stand i could almost feel my braincells shutting themselves down WITH EACH failed punchline DOT the TIME slot would be better served BY airing MORE coronation street air farce re runs ll kill him DOT THEN rf goes ON A LONG walk wherein he cycles through ALL OF the thoughts A confused parent might have such AS maybe we toilet trained him too soon DOT his thoughts ARE ALL triggered about their relationship DOT there were SOME kind OF sweetly quaint touches LIKE rf going TO buy ALL those books ON homosexuality AND sitting RIGHT down ON the park bench TO READ them i LIKE the idea became the symbol OF the star wars special edition OF A disaster OF monumental proportions involving A disgruntled director making several hideous changes TO A beloved classic mrs DOT whatsit has officially become my personal symbol FOR the confusion AND stupidity that IS A wrinkle IN TIME DOT the reason FOR this IS the fact that she has been mutated beyond belief DOT aside FROM the slightly controversial decision OF casting alfre woodard star trek FIRST contact AND radio AS our favorite star turned mentor the filmmakers decided it appropriate TO introduce her AS A crow DOT that s RIGHT A crow DOT moreover the heavenly centaurion form OF this greatly beloved CHARACTER has been hacked AT BY what looks TO be A demented eight YEAR OLD the majestic half man half horse WITH wings has become A huge human head WITH A creepy smile mounted awkwardly ON the bowlegged body OF A horse that happens TO be sporting A pair OF wings IN the middle DOT had i been five this would have psychologically traumatized me FOR life DOT the worst part IS the fact that WHEN it spoke it was shown FROM behind so AS TO avoid the responsibility TO lip sync resulting IN A scene that was spent looking AT the back tear inducing one the CHARACTERS the acting AND the story DOT i personally had ALWAYS imagined meg TO look somewhat SIMILAR TO moaning myrtle FROM the harry potter films plain hair glasses AND A figure most supermodels would find laughable DOT she was ALWAYS A slightly anxious humorously pessimistic math genius who quite simply could NOT have cared less about the imports AND exports OF text: this review CONTAINS spoilers FOR those who ARE NOT aware OF the details OF the TRUE story ON which this movie IS based DOT br br the RIGHT TO be presumed innocent UNTIL proven guilty IS A basic entitlement OF anyone IN A civilised society but ACCORDING TO fred schepisi s partisan but sadly convincing story OF A famous australian murder trial it was NOT GRANTED TO lindy chamberlain accused OF killing her baby DOT the story suggesting her innocence was unlikely A dingo was alleged TO have taken it but those implying her guilt even MORE so AND there was NO solid evidence against her DOT but the australian PUBLIC was transfixed BY the possibility OF her guilt AND the deeply religious chamberlains appeared creepy WHEN appearing IN the media AND the media themselves OF course were anything but innocent IN this process DOT so although cleared BY an initial inquest they were later prosecuted AND convicted DOT although chamberlain was eventually released this shamefully ONLY followed the discovery OF NEW evidence proving their innocence something NO defendants should have TO produce DOT br br A cry IN the dark IS well acted throughout especially BY meryl streep who puts ON A convincing australian accent AT LEAST TO this pom s ears AND manages keep lindy sympathetic TO us WHILE still conveying how she managed TO become A NATIONAL hate figure DOT the scenes WHERE she actually gets imprisoned ARE SIMPLE but heartbreaking because we believe IN the CHARACTERS AS REAL DOT br br regardless OF the accuracy OF its portrayal OF this story something i can T COMMENT ON the wider theme OF this film will ring horribly TRUE TO anyone WITH A PASSING knowledge OF the british popular press AND its ruthless habit OF appealing directly TO their readership s LEAST charitable instincts DOT NO legal SYSTEM will ever be perfect but the CURRENT cry against asylum seekers IN contemporary british tabloids comes FROM exactly the same pit OF evil AS the voices that put lindy chamberlain away DOT i M NOT A religious man but the bible still CONTAINS SOME killer lines IF you ll excuse the pun DOT judge NOT lest ye be judged IS one OF them DOT

text: A cry IN the dark br br A cry IN the dark was A film that i anticipated would offer A phenomenal performance FROM meryl streep AND A solid IF unremarkable film DOT this assumption came FROM the fact that aside FROM streep s best actress nomination the movie received little attention FROM major awards GROUPS DOT br br little did i anticipate that A cry IN the dark would be such A riveting drama well constructed ON EVERY LEVEL DOT IF you ask me this IS an UNDER appreciatted classic DOT br br the film opens rather slowly letting the audience settle INTO the chamberlain s AT A relaxed pace AND really notice that AT the core they ARE an incredibly loving SIMPLE FAMILY DOT fred schepisi the director selects random moments TO capture OF A FAMILY ON vacation that give A looming sense OF the oncoming tragedy WHILE ALSO showing the attentive bliss WITH which lindy streep AND michael sam neill chamberlain care FOR their children DOT br br WHILE the famous line A dingo took my baby has become somewhat OF A punchline these days the movie never even comes CLOSE TO laughable DOT the actual death OF azaria IS horrifyingly captured DOT it IS subtle AND realistic leaving the audience horrified AND asking questions DOT br br the majority OF the film takes place IN courtrooms AND focuses ON the chamberlain s continuous fight TO prove their innocence TO the press AND the court which suspects lindy OF murder DOT br br the fact that it IS clear TO us FROM the beginning that they ARE innocent makes the tense trials ALL the MORE gripping DOT AS an audience MEMBER i was fully invested text: IN august the disappearance OF baby azaria chamberlain AND the pursuant trial OF her parents lindy AND michael FOR the alleged murder OF the child caused an uproar across what was THEN A very angry nation DOT the media AND the PUBLIC had already tried AND convicted the accused couple AND were baying FOR blood DOT what followed was A gross miscarriage OF justice DOT br br michael AND lindy chamberlain claimed that WHILE camping near ayers rock central australia that A dingo had taken their ten week OLD daughter FROM their tent AS they were preparing TO eat IN the barbecue area DOT NO one believed them DOT lindy was charged WITH the murder OF her baby AND michael AS an accessory AFTER the fact DOT the whole country was abuzz WITH whispers OF A ritual killing DOT the chamberlain s trial was OVER BEFORE it began DOT br br lindy never proved her innocence so she was FOUND guilty DOT there was never enough evidence TO convict her yet the jury was swayed BY PUBLIC AND media pressure DOT how could we AS A nation even sit IN judgement FROM WHERE we ARE how could we possibly presume TO know unless there was ABSOLUTE proof AND NO reasonable doubt whatsoever the chamberlains should have been acquitted DOT br br fred schepisi s film unequivocally AND whole heartedly supports the argument OF john bryson s novel that the chamberlains were completely innocent OF the charges laid against them DOT that IN fact A dingo did take baby azaria ON that fateful night AT ayers rock DOT br br schepisi has brilliantly captured the mood OF A blood thirsty nation hell bent ON the truth being brought TO light DOT he shows australia IN A rather unbecoming light AS A people who were totally obsessed WITH seeing the chamberlains pay his screenplay co written WITH robert caswell DOT the entire support CAST ARE ALSO excellent WITH SOME OF australia s finest actors AND actresses playing A part DOT br br technically the film IS brilliant too WITH director OF photography ian baker capturing this great land WITH splendour especially the rock DOT editor jill bilcock keeps the whole movie tense AND very emotionally charged WHILE bruce smeaton provides A telling score DOT br br FOR ALL aussies this IS A must see A shocking look IN the mirror IF you will AT what we AS A country did TO A FAMILY who just wanted justice TO be served AND the truth TO be known DOT AS michael chamberlain said i don T think anybody really understands what innocence means DOT DOT DOT DOT DOT TO innocent people DOT br br saturday may video br br even ON RETURN viewings fred schepisi s account OF the travesty OF justice that befell the chamberlains who lost baby azaria AT ayres rock IN IS still emotionally powerful AND honestly moving DOT br br schepisi AND robert caswell have expertly transferred john bryson s novel TO the screen telling WITH simplicity the horrifying story OF A vacation gone terribly wrong FOR michael AND lindy chamberlain whose NEW born daughter azaria was taken form the FAMILY tent BY A dingo just moments AFTER being put down DOT br br amid media speculation AND vicious PUBLIC rumour lindy was charged WITH the murder OF her baby AND michael was charged AS an accessory AFTER the fact DOT what followed was little MORE than trial BY media AND WITH the australian people determined she be put away lindy was FOUND guilty AND sentenced TO life imprisonment WITH hard labour even though the prosecution could present NO motive AND little other than circumstantial evidence DOT br br meryl streep IS IN top form AS the accused woman who battles australia head ON TO prove her innocence DOT she IS truly awesome AND the ONLY thing that fails her IS A TRUE blue aussie accent though she does her LEVEL best TO sound ocker DOT you might wonder why A top australian WHILE he feels powerless TO DO anything about it DOT A strong aussie CAST lend compelling support DOT br br editing FROM jill bilcock IS very timely ian baker s cinematography OF the rock AND other text: i FOUND it hard TO LIKE anyone IN this film DOT the central CHARACTERS lindy AND michael chamberlain whose daughter disappears during A night OUT IN the australian outback ARE NOT bad people but THEN surely NOT ALL OR even most OF the scores OF people we see throughout this movie would be bad IF we knew them better DOT but though we ARE AS sure AS the film wants us TO be OF the guilt OR innocence OF the chamberlains FROM the START OF their life s tragic disarray the film takes ON A MORE OR less sociological perspective pertaining TO gossip news media crowds mobs AND assumptions DOT it s NOT A movie about the degenerate society OF australia IN particular it s merely an account OF A TRUE story that happened there DOT society en masse IS much less evolved than the individual feels ensured that we ARE DOT br br WHEN A warden insists upon killing ALL OF an aborigine s dogs because OF the unverified ACTION OF A single wild dog WHEN A randomly ruined life spins even further OUT OF CONTROL owing TO the majority OF magazines newspapers AND tv programs distorts the tragic truth TO A LEVEL OF drama that provokes its consumers INTO A frenzy there IS NO sign OF empathy OR even ANY kind OF looking outside OF one s own unaware perceptions influenced LEFT AND RIGHT BY the vigorous hearsay AND vibes OF those who surround one s life DOT the reason i appreciate the film IS because it turns the focus inside OUT FROM the victims TO the masses DOT br br the evidence against lindy chamberlain aside suspicion was jet fueled mostly BY A virtue OF hers DOT TO the PUBLIC eye she did NOT seem sufficiently distraught BY the death OF her baby daughter DOT why was she able TO keep her cool even A sort OF aloofness let alone holding her head up FOR tv AND the press how much OF the downward spiral could ve been prevented had she behaved MORE TO the PUBLIC s liking IN the media meryl streep one OF IF NOT the GREATEST actress working today may NOT give A performance that particularly stands OUT AND frankly neither does ANY other actor OR department OF film making DOT but she AND the screenwriters DO understand lindy DOT what IS infuriating IS that it s NOT that difficult DOT apparently she was NOT naturally prone TO showing emotion IN PUBLIC IN ANY CASE DOT whether OR NOT she IS approachable AS A lovable CHARACTER IN the IMMEDIATE sense we ARE naturally prone TO sympathize WITH her situation DOT br br whether OR NOT her performance IS AS IMMEDIATELY gratifying AS sophie s choice the devil wears prada angels IN america OR other such WORK it IS A triumph DOT it IS difficult enrapture an audience WHEN you purposely deny them insights INTO yourself DOT she frustrates us because we don T know what she s thinking OR feeling DOT it took me awhile TO feel endeared toward her but this IS the movie s way OF suggesting the reaction OF the PUBLIC s attention DOT br br she IS married TO A pastor AND they BOTH practice A religion that IS IN A small minority AND thus misinterpreted BY most DOT INITIALLY they react TO their loss AS IF TO be reconciling themselves TO god s will kick starting A rumor mill generating the notion that their daughter s death was SOME sort OF ritual killing ON their part DOT whatever happened TO the little girl her parents were part OF A margin WITH whom most OF the media s intake didn T IMMEDIATELY identify so the FIRST inclination was TO GO AFTER them LIKE A pack OF hungry DOT DOT DOT well DOT DOT DOT br br meryl streep AND sam neill ARE constantly ON screen but the australian PUBLIC plays the REAL leads here DOT LIKE punctuation FOR EACH plot advance director fred schepisi cuts away FROM restaurant TO tennis court TO dinner party TO saloon TO office WHERE the PUBLIC tries lindy AND gets carried away INTO their own passionate projections DOT br br this golan globus docudrama IS NOT particularly memorable DOT the setting s atmosphere doesn T give A pleasurable enough compensation FOR the fact that NO performance OR facet OF production stands OUT DOT but it IS very successful AS an indictment OF the collective conscious OF the PUBLIC DOT

text: i don T think anyone sitting down TO VIEW this film would be expecting anything remotely appearing LIKE A classic ghost story but you have TO ask yourself WHEN it s OVER IF you were ever scared ted fletcher edward albert can WRITE A book AND he brings along his wife laura susan george AND their daughter amy amy barrett DOT their friend alex curtis doug mcclure who works AT the american consulate helps them find A house TO live IN AND he finds one that IS haunted DOT about years earlier IN the same house A samurai FOUND his wife cheating ON him AND he kills BOTH OF them AND THEN the business OR working ONLY sporadically DOT this isn T A bad film but it s never convincing AND watching the ghosts scurry around WHEN the monk gives an exorcism IS practically worthy OF A giggle OR text: the film opens WITH A peaceful shot OF A traditional japanese house complete WITH thatched roof that sits ON the side OF A small hill AND an ON screen caption appears that READS kushiata kyoto japan DOT A young japanese trainee samurai named masanori toshiya maruyama walks up the winding PATH TO the house inside waits otami mako hattori WITH whom he IS HAVING an affair behind her husband shugoro s tsuiyuki sasaki AS toshiyuki sasaki back who happens TO be masanori s teacher DOT shugoro unexpectedly arrives home TO find his wife AND student HAVING very intimate relations WITH EACH other DOT his honour destroyed the enraged samurai brutally murders BOTH otami AND masanori BEFORE committing suicide DOT OVER A century later AND ted fletcher edward albert arrives IN japan ON A working holiday WITH his wife laura susan george AND their young daughter amy amy barrett DOT their CLOSE friend alex curtis doug mcclure who works FOR the american consulate helps them OUT BY finding them A place TO stay you don T need me TO you WHERE he jokingly says it s going so cheap because it s haunted TO which BOTH ted AND laura laugh OFF AS they obviously don T believe IN ghosts AT LEAST FOR the TIME being that IS DOT almost IMMEDIATELY the film goes INTO clich MODE DOT lights turn ON AND OFF BY themselves laura has an uneasy feeling about the place AND A LOCAL zen monk henry mitowa gives them an ominous warning FOR them TO LEAVE BEFORE it s too late which they IGNORE OF course DOT the spirits OF otami masanori AND shugoro were doomed FOR eternity TO remain WITHIN the walls OF the house because OF A majyo witches tsuyako olajima curse put upon them DOT but there may be A way they can break the curse unfortunately FOR the fletcher FAMILY it could potentially COST them their marriage daughter AND possibly even their very lives DOT br br directed BY kevin connor i thought this was A pretty average film ok TO watch once IF you ve got NOTHING better TO DO but AFTER A DAY OR two you ll probably have completely forgotten it DOT NOTHING sticks IN the memory AS being particularly bad but ON the other hand there s NOTHING particularly good about the film either DOT the script BY robert suhosky FROM the novel BY james hardiman IS A little ON the dull side AND strictly BY the numbers A lot OF ghostly goings ON happen throughout the film but NONE OF it IS very interesting OR exciting AND the flat CHARACTERS AND direction doesn T help things DOT there ARE couple OF silly SEQUENCES LIKE the giant plastic crabs that try TO GET amy AND her babysitter noriko mayumi umeda DOT AND there IS A scene WHERE the zen monk exorcises the house AND the ghosts ARE banished outside unable TO GET back IN however that IS UNTIL ted simply opens the door AND they just walk RIGHT back IN apart FROM A couple OF mostly OFF screen decapitations there s NO blood gore OR violence TO speak about DOT the transparent ghost effects ARE ok but they ain T going TO impress many people these days text: AT the beginning OF the film you might DOUBLE CHECK the dvd cover AND re READ the synopsis A couple OF times but NO worries DOT it s NOT memoirs OF A geisha that you purchased just A movie WITH an intro that IS much MORE classy AND stylish than it has ANY RIGHT TO be DOT still the opening IS BY far the best thing about the entire movie AS it shows how IN the YEAR A samurai sword master catches his wife committing adultery DOT he decapitates the two lovers BEFORE doing SOME hara kiri ritual suicide through disembowelment DOT cut TO present DAY WHEN the american ambassador IN japan welcomes A befriended FAMILY AND drives them up TO the same house WHERE the aforementioned slaughter took place nearly one AND A half century ago DOT FROM THEN onwards this becomes A seemingly ROUTINE haunted house flick yet the utterly retarded AND implausible script still makes it somewhat exceptional DOT let s START WITH the good aspects namely the original japanese setting AND the presence OF the delicious susan george who IS my ALL TIME favorite british horror wench well together WITH britt eckland linda hayden AND ingrid pitt DOT the bad aspects simply include that the screenplay IS incoherent imbecilic beyond repair AND FULL OF supposedly unsettling twists that ONLY evoke laughter DOT the restless spirits OF the house soon BEGIN TO entertain themselves BY perpetrating INTO the bodies OF the NEW tenants AND causing them TO DO AND say ALL sorts OF crazy stuff DOT the spirit OF the massacred adulterous woman particularly enjoys squeezing INTO susan s ravishing booty AND transforming her INTO A lewd seductress IN this possessed STATE she even lures the american ambassador outside TO have sex IN the garden OF A high society diner party FULL OF prominent guests DOT so strictly spoken it s NOT really evil that dwells IN the house just A trio OF sleazy ghosts WITH dirty minds AND far too much FREE TIME ON their LONG dead hands obviously these scenes ARE MORE comical than frightening especially since the light blue AND transparent shapes remind you OF the cute ghost effects that were later popularized IN ghostbusters DOT the house WHERE evil dwells IS probably the LEAST scary ghost movie ever DOT throughout most OF the running TIME you ll be wondering whether director kevin connor who nevertheless made the excellent horror films motel hell AND FROM beyond the grave intentionally wanted TO make his movie funny AND OVER the top LIKE motel hell maybe DOT but THEN again everyone IN the CAST continues TO speak his her lines WITH A straight AND sincere face so i guess we ARE nevertheless supposed TO take everything seriously AND feel disturbed DOT the house WHERE evil dwells IS never suspenseful OR even remotely exciting AND it doesn T even contain ANY grisly images apart FROM the massacre AT the beginning DOT i am fully aware OF how shallow it sounds but the two scenes IN which susan george goes topless ARE the ONLY TRUE highlights DOT well those AND maybe ALSO the invasion OF cheesy AND ridiculously OVER sized spiders OR ARE they crabs IN the daughter s bedroom DOT how totally random AND irrelevant was that IF you ever decide TO give this movie A chance notwithstanding its bad reputation make sure you LEAVE your common sense AND reasoning AT the doorstep DOT br br trivia note FOR horror buffs keep an eye OPEN FOR the demon mask that was ALSO A pivot piece OF scenery IN the brilliant japanese horror classic onibaba DOT
label: safe.txt

text: this was usually producer alexander korda s advice ON SET TO many OF his underlings the film IS credited WITH three directors but IN truth alex zoltan korda AND william cameron menzies helped OUT pushing it TO six DOT br br FOR john kobal s book the top movies his survey OF film critics saw the thief OF bagdad reach th place DOT A closer examination reveals ONLY jose luis guarner john russell taylor AND kobal himself actually voted FOR the picture but their high placings were enough TO take it TO near the half way mark DOT br br the outbreak OF the SECOND world war saw the movie s production shifted around england AND america eventually seeing completion IN AND winning three technical oscars DOT LIKE citizen kane it IS IN SOME ways perhaps A film you might admire rather than love DOT br br the special effects outstanding FOR the TIME ARE still reasonable AND actually HOLD up IF you squint DOT but it s NOT so much their effectiveness AS the audacity OF the inventions DOT among them IS an amusing horse constructed OUT OF A kit model which WHEN A KEY IS inserted up it s rear END begins TO fly DOT there s ALSO A killer toy OF the six armed goddess kali perhaps quite obviously A single woman WITH two women sitting behind her AND A quite horrific looking giant spider DOT ALSO impressing IS the climax WITH its wonderful flying carpet DOT but most memorable has TO be rex ingram appearing AS IN A superb moment OF cinematic conceit A djinn genie nearly A thousand feet tall ingram portrays the genie AS quite A menacing creature AND adds an ELEMENT OF danger TO the proceedings DOT AND look OUT FOR the moment WHERE he s tricked back INTO his bottle br br john justin does well AS the arabic king who FOR SOME strange reason has an english accent AND A stiff UPPER lip DOT sabu the astonishingly muscled YEAR OLD IS near namesake abu A likeably cocky thief DOT AFTER they CROSS paths WITH the evil jaffer conrad veidt justin finds himself blind AND abu IS turned INTO A dog DOT WHEN it seems the rest OF the film will be told IN flashback through the blind ahmed s justin s perspective we find that halfway through the movie we catch up TO the present AND the adventure continues DOT IN truth the SECOND half IS someway the better being FULL OF greater incident AND MORE fantastical IN nature DOT br br three small songs pepper the piece though AS the film lasts FOR minutes this feels MORE LIKE mild flavouring rather than A REAL ingredient i wouldn T classify this AS A musical DOT it s ALL great fun justin AND june duprez ARE the love interest FOR the mums AND dads veidt IS the boo hiss villain AND abu IS the youthful irrepressible robber DOT it may take A WHILE TO GET INTO the somewhat dated mindset AND overblown melodrama OF s english movies but once you ve sat through the FIRST half an HOUR OR so this film really draws you IN DOT quite commendable DOT

text: the story line OF the thief OF bagdad IS complex owing TO its being told IN flashbacks AND HAVING three separate AND equally important strands woven together DOT the screenplay BY lajo biros AND the dialogue BY miles malleson keep the story moving skillfully AT ALL points DOT the young king ahmad OF bagdad IS angry AT his vizier jaffar FOR executing A man FOR HAVING different ideas DOT he discovers WHILE IN disguise that people blame him FOR jaffar s deeds AND hate him DOT he IS imprisoned BY jaffar WHERE he meets abu the young thief DOT the two ESCAPE AND take A boat TO the city OF basra DOT there the companions spy WHEN men clear the way so NONE will see the princess OF the city PASSING BY DOT ahmad falls IN love WITH her AND visits her IN her garden DOT he tells her he has come TO her FROM beyond TIME AND wins A kiss DOT THEN he IS captured DOT WHEN jaffar comes TO win the princess OF basra FOR himself ahmad attacks the evil vizier who blinds him AND turns abu INTO A dog DOT jaffar THEN asks FOR the princess s hand AND he gives the gift OF A mechanical flying horse TO the sultan OF basra DOT the blind ahmad THEN tells his tale IN the marketplace accompanied BY abu AS his dog DOT the prince has fallen INTO A sleep AND NOTHING can wake her DOT so jaffar sends his servant halima FOR ahmad AND the dog IN hopes the prince can rouse her DOT he does awaken her DOT she boards A ship TO find A doctor TO cure ahmad but she IS captured BY jaffar who THEN throws the dog overboard DOT she THEN allows jaffar TO take her IN his arms ON his promise TO RESTORE ahmad s sight AND turn abu back INTO A thief DOT the princess sees A vision OF ahmad he IS IN A boat jaffar sends A storm TO beset him AND abu IS shipwrecked ON A deserted island DOT abu finds A genie OR djinn who wants TO kill him now that he IS FREE AFTER many centuries spent imprisoned IN A bottle DOT abu tricks him INTO proving he really came FROM so small A vessel THEN corks him IN again DOT FOR freeing him he gets three wishes DOT his FIRST IS FOR sausages DOT IN the meanwhile the princess pleads WITH her father TO refuse jaffar but jaffar shows the sultan A NEW mechanical toy one OF whose six arms stabs him TO death DOT abu makes A SECOND wish TO find ahmad DOT the cunning genie flies him TO the goddess OF the ALL seeing eye DOT abu has TO climb A great web TO GET TO the gem that IS the eye battling A giant spider THEN scaling the goddess s statue DOT abu gazes INTO the eye AND sees ahmad IN A canyon DOT he has the genie take him TO ahmad DOT ahmad uses the eye TO see the princess DOT she smells A flower AND forgets everything AT once DOT abu wishes they were IN bagdad but the genie laughs AND leaves jaffar tells the princess that she IS IN love WITH him omitting mention OF ahmad DOT ahmad tries TO fight his way TO the princess but jaffar smashes the eye DOT abu finds himself IN the land OF legend WHERE the OLD men who RULE want TO make him their king DOT he steals A bow AND A magic carpet AND escapes INSTEAD TO hurry TO save ahmad AND the princess DOT the thief arrives IN TIME TO save the young king FROM the executioner USING his bow FROM the flying carpet TO the wonder OF the throng who had come TO watch the execution DOT jaffar tries TO flee ON the mechanical flying horse but another shot FROM the bow finishes him DOT ahmad IS ruler again AND PLANS TO wed his princess but WHEN he tries TO make abu his vizier the young thief refuses saying that what he wants IS adventure NOT hard WORK AND confinement IN A palace however grand it may be DOT this fantastic story was given A sumptuous production BY producer alexander korda DOT the production was designed BY vincent korda who was ALSO art director WHILE georges perinal did the colorful cinematography DOT the directors credited ARE ludwig berger AND michael powell WITH tim whelan alexander korda william cameron menzies AND zoltan korda participating DOT the extraordinary AND numerous costumes designs were the WORK OF john armstrong oliver messel AND marcel vertes DOT the production apart FROM its gorgeous AND expensive looking visual splendors i claim IS dominated BY two other elements the choral music OF miklos rozsa AND the performance BY conrad veidt AS the evil jaffar DOT rex ingram plays the genie WITH A curious accent plus his usual intelligence AND POWER DOT june duprez IS lovely AND effective AS the princess mary morris IS A sad AND beautiful halima AND miles malleson A properly bumbling AND avaricious sultan DOT AS ahmad john justin appears TO DO most OF what can be done WITH the part OF A young prince IN love AND THEN SOME he IS memorably good IN his winning ROLE DOT this film has A spaciousness about it that IS FOUND i assert IN other korda works ALSO DOT its imaginative text: the movie tells the tale OF A prince whose life IS wonderful but AFTER an evil wizard tells him TO GO INTO town disguised AS A beggar the wizard THEN locks up the prince AND soon becomes the shadow ruler OF baghdad DOT the jailed prince meets A thief CALLED abu who helps him ESCAPE the jail AND head TO A town CALLED basra WHERE he meets A princess who he falls madly IN love WITH but unbeknown TO him the evil wizard jafa IS ALSO IN love WITH the princess AND tries TO convince her father TO allow him TO marry her DOT jafa soon learns that the prince IS trying TO win the girls heart so he makes him blind AND turns abu INTO A dog DOT this leads TO the prince AND abu going OFF ON an adventure TO find A way TO defeat jafa RESTORE peace TO baghdad AND marry the princess DOT during their journey they encounter everything FROM sarcastic genies that takes abu ON A flight through the clouds A giant spider that s really hungry AND A flying horse that probably gives birth TO one OF the most beautiful SEQUENCE these OLD eyes OF mine have ever seen DOT br br this IS A pure fantasy movie FROM START TO finish it has flying horses genies flying carpets AND wizards that can actually DO magic INSTEAD OF just hit people WITH their staffs DOT it doesn T have ANY cheesy moments AND the love story isn T A waste OF TIME DOT the production designs ARE just stunning IN this movie DOT FROM the palaces TO the different dangerous traps that the heroes encounter DOT even though this movie IS OVER years OLD the production design IS far better than most OF the crap that gets tacked ON IN today s cinema DOT the music AND songs ARE ALSO well done DOT anyone who sees it will NO doubt hail i want TO be A sailor sailing ON the seas AS one OF the great musical moments IN movies DOT i M usually NOT A huge fan OF singing IN movies since i find them about AS enjoyable AS doing my taxes but i ll be MORE than happy TO make an EXCEPTION FOR this movie DOT br br what sells the movie FOR me IS the sheer fact that you GET TO see things you don T see IN everyday life which IS ALSO the same reason why i love stuff LIKE two towers AND silent hill DOT way BEFORE today s modern fantasy movie came along WITH their realistic cgi TO blow our minds there was this movie which blew your mind WITHOUT HAVING green screen scattered ALL OVER the place DOT one OF my favorite shots IN two towers IS the one WHERE we see the trolls opening the black gates the main appeal OF that shot FOR me was seeing these great fantasy beings doing what IS essentially manual labor AND that s what i love about the genie AND other creatures IN the movie DOT they re just there trying TO make A living just LIKE everyone ELSE which gives them A REAL feel even though they re ALL just fantasy beings DOT br br it s literally impossible TO watch this movie AND NOT notice WHERE the makers OF aladdin got their inspiration DOT the CHARACTERS FROM this movie ARE pretty much the same CHARACTERS IN that movie FROM the talkative genie RIGHT down TO the flying carpet DOT it s NOT an entirely bad thing IN my eyes since it s nice TO know that i M NOT the ONLY one ON the planet that has A deep passionate love FOR this amazing movie DOT i FIRST saw this AS A kid IN the motherland AND thought it was the GREATEST thing IN the world AND upon watching it again LAST week i still think it s amazing DOT that s A TRUE testament that A great movie can withstand the test OF TIME DOT sure the effects look A wee BIT outdated AND cheesy but it was made way back IN the s so give it A break DOT NOT everything looks outdated though since most OF the stuff can still HOLD its own today WHEN scrutinized UNDER today s standard DOT br br IF you ever wanted TO see A live ACTION VERSION OF aladdin THEN you should GET your wish WITH this but the angry cynical bunch will probably DO good IN avoiding this since this won T be their cup OF tea DOT

text: mario lanza OF course IS the great caruso IN this film ALSO starring ann blyth dorothy kirsten eduard franz AND ludwig donath DOT this IS A highly fictionalized biography OF the legendary world renowned tenor whose NAME IS known even today DOT br br the film IS opulently produced AND the music IS glorious AND beautifully sung BY lanza kirsten judmila novotna blanche thebom AND other opera stars who appeared IN the film DOT IF you re A purist seeing people ON stage smiling during the sextet FROM lucia will strike you AS odd even IF caruso s wife dorothy just had A baby girl DOT ALSO it s highly unlikely that caruso ever sang edgardo IN lucia the ROLE lay too high FOR him DOT br br IN taking dramatic license the script leaves OUT SOME very dramatic parts OF caruso s life DOT what was so remarkable about him IS that he actually created roles IN operas that ARE today IN the standard repertoire yet this IS never mentioned IN the film DOT these roles include maurizio IN adriana lecouvreur AND dick johnson IN girl OF the golden west there IS A famous photo OF him posing WITH A sheet wrapped around him LIKE A toga DOT the reason FOR that photo his ONLY shirt was IN the laundry DOT he was one OF the pioneers OF recorded music AND had A LONG partnership WITH the victor talking machine company later rca victor DOT he was singing jose IN carmen IN san francisco the night OF the earthquake DOT br br INSTEAD the mgm story basically has him dying ON stage during A performance OF martha which never happened DOT he had A hemorrhage during l elisir d amore AT the met AND could NOT finish the performance he ONLY sang three MORE times AT the met his LAST ROLE AS eleazar IN la juive DOT what killed him the same thing that killed valentino peritonitis DOT his FIRST ROLE AT the met was NOT radames IN aida AS indicated IN the film but the duke IN rigoletto DOT so WHEN it says ON the screen suggested BY dorothy caruso s biography OF her husband that s what it was suggested DOT what IS TRUE IS that dorothy s father disowned her AFTER her marriage AND LEFT her OF his massive estate DOT they ALSO did have A daughter gloria together who died AT the age OF ON DOT however caruso had four other children BY A mistress BEFORE he married dorothy DOT br br SOME people say that lanza s voice IS remarkably LIKE caruso s but just LISTEN TO caruso sing IN the film MATCH point caruso s voice IS remarkably unlike lanza s DOT IN fact FROM his sound had he wanted TO caruso could have sung AS A baritone DOT he IS thought TO have had SOME trouble WITH high notes further evidence OF baritone leanings AND the ROLE he was preparing WHEN he died was othello A dramatic tenor ROLE which lanza definitely was NOT DOT lanza s voice deserved NOT TO be compared WITH another DOT he made A UNIQUE contribution TO film history popularizing operatic music DOT he sings the music IN the great caruso WITH A robust energy he IS truly here AT the peak OF what would be A short career DOT his acting IS NATURAL AND genuine DOT ann blyth IS lovely AS dorothy AND gets TO sing A little herself DOT br br really A film FOR opera lovers AND lanza fans which ARE probably one AND the same DOT

AND his wife osa who made several documentaries sometimes WITH blatantly staged events IN africa AND asia DOT the johnsons safari films were extremely popular inspiring several parodies DOT DOT DOT most notably wheeler woolsey s so this IS africa IN which the very sexy esther muir plays A CHARACTER named mrs DOT johnson martini INSTEAD OF martin e DOT johnson geddit DOT although several other text: BEFORE sunrise has many remarkable things going ON almost too many TO fit INTO one review LIKE this but it s suffice TO say that it s one OF the most observant CHARACTER studies OF the nineties maybe even IN ALL OF contemporary cinema TO be observant NOT about love per say so much AS it s about A human CONNECTION DOT how does one fall IN love AT FIRST sight NO one does AT LEAST that s deep down the consensus that linklater wants TO SHOW WITH his film DOT AND yet there IS the possibility OF AS intense A CONNECTION OF A bond that can form IN those that ARE young AND WITH many ideas that can be expressed articulately AND WITH A BREADTH OF cynicism AND IS somehow very tender AND TRUE AT the same TIME DOT linklater here gives us the story OF celine AND jessie A french girl AND an american boy who GET OFF the same train heading TO vienna AND ON the way there START TO talking about things AT FIRST arbitrary THEN personal jessie seeing death FOR the FIRST TIME IN his great grandfather DOT jessie persuades celine TO GO along WITH him ON A night OUT ON the town IN vienna UNTIL his plane the NEXT morning DOT br br BEFORE sunrise gives jessie AND celine IN the midst OF the gorgeous vienna scenery AND locales TO GO ON AND ON about subjects that have A lot OF importance AND IN A sense IS about the act OF HAVING conversations OF what it s LIKE TO watch people HAVING one LEADING INTO another AND another DOT here it s often about relationships AND commitments AS jessie AND celine tell stories sometimes somewhat inconsequential OR seemingly so AND another that may tell A lot about their essential qualities DOT we hear confessions OF desires FOR other loves OR what weren T really loves OF being part OF A FAMILY OR part OF an upbringing that may OR may NOT inform how you ll love your life OF what it means TO believe OR NOT believe IN SOME religious form OR just TO have SOME CONNECTION TO ANY faith AND the soul i loved the BIT about the quakers IN the church AND sometimes laced WITH cynicism OR skepticism DOT jessie may be MORE responsible FOR that LAST part but what s fascinating about the film IS that it s never exactly cynical itself just commenting upon cynicism that lays IN the concerns OF men AND women AT that age OF their lives DOT br br meanwhile it s ALWAYS great TO see ethan hawke AND julie delpy IN these roles WHERE they re NOT incessantly annoying IN that s generation x MODE but ARE the kinds OF people WHERE IF NOT IN the central conceit OF the film which isn T A bad one AT ALL but A necessary one one might think TO find walking along the streets OF A city somewhere DOT the conceit IS that OF an OLD romantic picture ala brief encounter ONLY here intimacy IS expressed IN the central CHARACTERS either BETWEEN EACH other WHERE sweet asides ARE actually acceptable i have TO tell you A secret jessie says AND THEN leans IN FOR A kiss ho ho OR IN the little moments that pop up WITH other people along the way DOT i loved the scene WITH the poet WHERE it s very cinematic A thing TO suddenly find A random romantic BIT player IN the midst OF A romantic picture WITH such beautiful words AT his disposal OR WITH the palm reader AND how the reactions FROM jessie AND celine ARE that we might SHARE but really ARE seeing them DO it FIRST hand DOT ALL the WHILE hawke AND delpy embody the roles interestingly we can see how neuroses ARE being formed already FOR their adult lives AS it may LEAD OFF INTO the future DOT DOT DOT br br featuring splendid cinematography AND A script WITH an ear FOR NATURAL wit AND A TRUE sense OF what it means TO have A moment OF happiness however SELF contained AS it may LEAD INTO something MORE DOT who s TO say you can T suddenly be attached TO someone IF ONLY FOR less than hours AND be that much MORE attached than A married couple this IS perhaps linklater s thesis but there s MORE TO it than just that DOT it s A very dense film AND one that will have me calling back TO it repeatedly DOT one
